Pharyngoconjunctival fever (PCF) is associated with adenovirus types 3, 4 and 7.
1 ,
7 It is highly contagious and spreads rapidly amongst individuals living or working in close proximity with one another. Unlike EKC, systemic symptoms predominate, with pharyngitis, tender pre-auricular lymphadenopathy, fever and an acute follicular conjunctivitis.
